intro: Caulinia graminea, commonly known as the grassy caulinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters. Caulinia graminea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
